intro: Dianthus caryophyllus var. carduinus, commonly known as the heartsease or common carnation, is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, double flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. Native to Europe, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its flowers are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant colors and long-lasting blooms.
